Caption: Fig. 1. Web-based dashboard showing the NSF organizational structure using a treemap (left) as well as a Person Profile (right) in the DIA2 platform.

Fig. 2. DIA2 includes a range of services that allow better visual presentation of collaboration data. Nodes represent researchers and links are proposals that have been awarded by NSF. These visualizations also show capacity building within each program (organizational structure).
Fig. 5. DIA2 Guide available to users at the launch of the alpha version. The guide provides a simple selector that users can select to learn about each widget and launch it.
Fig. 3. DIA2 provides a full range of analytics focused on geographical locations. The first graph in the inset is the GDCS working in the “Comparison Mode”.
Fig. 4. Search service interacts with the rules engine and visualization services to provide end users with highly aggregated results as opposed to long list of results.
